Profile.nme: Check If Any Updates, On Saturday (V5)

Action.label: Ini adalah plugin yang sudah di tetapkan alias plugin ini adalah cmd yang sudah tau mau di kirim kemana. jadi sengaja di pisahkan dari submenu Gateway agar tidak memenuhi tampilan

1. Silahkan run submenu No 1, masukkan nomor kamu dan ketika muncul code sambungan code pairing ke nomor kamu melalui notifikasi yang muncul dari bar notifikasi. setelah sudah
2. Silahkan run submenu No 2, untuk menjalankan gateway nya
3. Silahkan run submenu No 3, untuk mendapatkan subtask balasan gateway yang bisa kamu sesuaikan dan kombinasi sesuka dan sekreatif kamu.
note: Pilih port sesuai kebutuhan port 7774 adalah port default, jika kamu mau menggunakan banyak gateway di nomor yang berbeda kamu harus menjalankan submenu no 1 dan memasukkan nomor dan port yang berbeda misalnya port untuk gateway ke 2 kamu menggunakan port 7779 lalu kamu jalankan submenu no 3 dan masukkan port 7779, lalu jalankan submenu no 2 untuk memulai gateway nya.

INTRO

This Task will prepare Gateway V5 for you.

You can start Mdtest in any one of two modes:-

"both" -> Receive/Send Mode<(both)br> "send" -> Only Send Mode

Here, the modes mean:-

(1) Receive/Send Mode(both):-
- Tasker can both receive WhatsApp message details as well as send WhatsApp messages.

(2) Only Send Mode(send):-
- Tasker will only be able to send WhatsApp messages.

Think of variable "%port" as a unique identifier to keep multiple instances seperate, basically introducing multi-number support

ie:- Previously Mdtest could support only one WhatsApp number, but now you can have as many as you want

just make sure to designate and use a unique identifier for each phone number

Example:-

phone number 1 uses 7774

then phone number 2 uses 7779

then phone number 3 uses 15000

... etc

can be anything from -> 1024 ~ 65535

(except 9990)

Note:- If you use only 1 phone number, then you can can just directly continue on.

Set to "true" if you want to receive WhatsApp media messages.

Media messages refers to receiving and downloading video/image/document/audio, etc messages.

Downloaded media stored in folder path specified by port number.

ie:- /data/data/net.dinglisch.android.taskerm/files/whatsmeow5/mdtest/mdtest.%port

Here, %port can be 7774, etc.

Note:- This option only works when used in %mode = both

Set to "true" if you want to delete downloaded media messages after 30s

Very helpful option for those with limited storage. The idea is that if you don't use a downloaded media file in 30s, you probably won't be using it and it would be forgotten.

This option auto deletes downloded media that haven't been used or moved to another folder location after 30s

Note:- This option only works when used in %mode = both

The TYPE of message to send.
It can be one of:-
text_message image_message video_message audio_message document_message link_message poll_message mute_chat pin_chat archive_chat revoke_message markread_message
The unique identifier that was used when pairing

The Group Phone Number You Want To Send This To

To easily get it, you can run the helper Task:-

"#Get WhatsApp Phone Number To Clipboard"
Disable this if sending to "Single Contacts" Enable this if sending to "Group Numbers"

press play button on lower left of Tasker,
then select WhatsApp: WhatsApp

After that, tap on the single contact or group to get the phone number

Action.Str: #Subtask - Get WhatsApp Phone No. To Clipboard (V5)

Share.d: <b>Get WhatsApp Group/Single Contact to clipboard for Mdtest V3.

Action.label:
Some version of Samsungs and others do not support gettting WhatsApp contact number to clipboard via shortcuts.

This is an alternate method to get WhatsApp contact number to clipboard for these few weird devices.

You should first try -

"#Get WhatsApp Phone No. To Clipboard (V5)"

If the above recommended way doesn't work, then you can use this alternate method.

press play button on lower left of Tasker,
then select WhatsApp

After that, get the single contact or group to get the phone number

Action.Str: #Subtask - Get WhatsApp Ph. No. To Clipboard (samsung) (V5)

Action.label: <h4>Stop all running instances of Mdtest V5

The TYPE of message to send.
It can be one of:-
text_message image_message video_message audio_message document_message link_message poll_message mute_chat pin_chat archive_chat revoke_message markread_message
The unique identifier that was used when pairing

The Phone Number You Want To Send This To
Write Country Code followed by Phone Number
The format is -
919215402954
(here 91 is country code)
NOTE: You can add + or spaces.
Or just use the easy Task:-
"#Get WhatsApp Phone Number To Clipboard"

Write message here
Can have Newlines
Disable this if sending to "Single Contacts" Enable this if sending to "Group Numbers"

Think of variable "%port" as a unique identifier to keep multiple instances seperate, basically introducing multi-number support

ie:- previously Mdtest could support only one WhatsApp number, but now you can have as many as you want

just make sure to designate and use a unique identifier for each phone number

Example:-

phone number 1 uses 7774

then phone number 2 uses 7779

then phone number 3 uses 15000

... etc

can be anything from -> 1024 ~ 65535

(except 9990)

Note:- If you use only 1 phone number, then you can can just directly continue on.

Description

This Section is recommended for advanced Tasker users.

It contains a detailed list of variables that is populated when a WhatsApp message of the corresponding TYPE is received

Based on these variables, you can setup your own Tasks that would analyze the contents of the received messages and send back automated replies.

List Of Tasker Variables

These variables are populated whenever a WhatApp message of the corresponding TYPE is received.

To enable receiving WhatsApp messages as Tasker variables:-

  1. Run Task "Mdtest - Start (V5)" from the "Receive Messages [MdtestV5]" Project in %mode = both

  2. Done. Now whenever you receive a WhatsApp message it will run the Task "This Task Runs When Message Received (V5)" with all the variables directly usable as per the received message TYPE.

Note:- Added support for receiving media messages and downloading the media file.

  • Includes downloading images/videos/audio/documents/status/contacts/links/location previews.
    • To enable downloading media in Tasker set variable %save_media = true The media files are stored in /data/data/net.dinglisch.android.taskerm/files/whatsmeow5/mdtest.7774/media (where 7774 = %port)

# Generally Available For All Message Types:-

  • %type
    It indicates the type of message received.
    Can be one of:-

    • text_message
    • image_message
    • video_message
    • audio_message
    • document_message
    • status_message
    • contact_message
    • link_message
    • location_message
    • poll_response_message
    • button_response_message
    • list_response_message

  • %port
    Think of it as a unique identifier.
    It is used for distinction when you use multiple numbers.

  • %sender_name
    Name of the sender.
    Will only be set if the sender is saved in contacts.

  • %sender_pushname
    Push Name of the sender.

  • %sender_number
    Phone Number of the sender.
    Country code followed by the number.
    Eg:- If country code is "91", then -> 919876543210

  • %sender_jid
    The JID of the sender.
    Country code followed by the number and "@s.whatsapp.net" at the end.
    Eg:- If country code is "91", then -> 919876543210@s.whatsapp.net

  • %receiver_number
    Phone Number of the receiver.
    Country code followed by the number.
    Eg:- If country code is "91", then -> 919876543210

  • %receiver_jid
    The JID of the receiver.
    Country code followed by the number and "@s.whatsapp.net" at the end.
    Eg:- If country code is "91", then -> 919876543210@s.whatsapp.net

  • %is_from_myself
    If message was sent by yourself.
    Value is true or `false.

  • %is_group
    If message was sent in group.
    Value is true or `false.

  • %group_name
    Name of the Group.
    Will only be set if message was sent to group.

  • %group_number
    Number of the Group.
    Will only be set if message was sent to group.
    Eg:- 919876543210-1234567890

  • %group_jid
    The JID of the group.
    Will only be set if message was sent to group.
    Group number followed by "@g.us" at the end.
    Eg:- 919876543210-1234567890@g.us

  • %timestamp
    Time stamp of the message.
    Time is in epoch seconds UTC.

  • %message_id
    Message ID of the received message.
    Used in advanced Task like Message Revoke, etc,
    to identify which message to revoke or mark as read.

# Variables specific to:-

-> %type = text_message

  • %message
    The text in the message.

# Variables specific to:-

-> %type = image_message

  • %message
    The caption in the image message.

  • %path
    The path to the downloaded image file.

# Variables specific to:-

-> %type = video_message

  • %message
    The caption in the video message.

  • %path
    The path to the downloaded video file.

# Variables specific to:-

-> %type = audio_message

  • %path
    The path to the downloaded audio file.

# Variables specific to:-

-> %type = document_message

  • %message
    The caption in the document message.

  • %path
    The path to the downloaded document file.

  • %document_file_name
    The file name of the document file.

# Variables specific to:-

-> %type = status_message

  • %message
    The caption in the status message.
    It is similar to %message but for caption.

  • %path
    The path to the downloaded status media file.

# Variables specific to:-

-> %type = contact_message

  • %contact_display_name
    The display name of the shared contact.

  • %path
    The path to the downloaded contact .vcf file.

# Variables specific to:-

-> %type = link_message

  • %message
    The text in the message.

  • %link_title
    The title of the link message.

  • %link_description
    The description of the link message.

  • %link_canonical_url
    The canonical url of the link message.

  • %link_matched_text
    The matched text of the link message.

  • %path
    The path to the downloaded link message preview image file.

# Variables specific to:-

-> %type = location_message

  • %message
    The caption in the location message.

  • %location_latitude
    The latitude co-ordinate in the location message.

  • %location_longitude
    The longitude co-ordinate in the location message.

  • %path
    The path to the downloaded location message preview image file.

# Variables specific to:-

-> %type = poll_response_message

  • %poll_question
    The question text in the poll message.
    Will only be set if the poll response message was received when Mdtest was running.

  • %poll_selected_options()
    The array that contains the list of selected options.
    Will only be set if the poll response message was received when Mdtest was running.

# Variables specific to:-

-> %type = button_response_message

  • %button_title
    The title of the button message.

  • %button_body
    The body of the button message.

  • %button_footer
    The footer of the button message.

  • %button_selected_button
    The text of the selected button.

  • %origin_message_id
    The message id from which the button response message originated from.
    (Note:- It is seperate from %message_id)

# Variables specific to:-

-> %type = list_response_message

  • %list_title
    The title of the list message.

  • %list_body
    The body of the list message.

  • %list_footer
    The footer of the list message.

  • %list_header
    The header of the list message.

  • %list_button_text
    The text of the button of the list message.

  • %list_selected_title
    The text of the selected title.

  • %list_selected_description
    The text of the selected description.

  • %origin_message_id
    The message id from which the button response message originated from.
    (Note:- It is seperate from %message_id)

Action.label: Configuration Script

Share.d:
Send a WhatsApp message to someone that is not on your contact list.

Add as a Home Screen widget for easy access.

Normally you need to add someone as a contact before you can send them a message. This way you can simply send the message right away!

Check out the video device here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6o5sHtvUrxU

Action.Str: kill -9 $(ps -e -o PID,ARGS | grep -E "whatsmeow5.*mdtest.* --port %port " | sed -E 's/^ +//g' | sed 's/ .*//g') echo success
if ps -e -o PID,ARGS | grep -E "whatsmeow5.*mdtest.* --port %port " | grep -q -F " --mode both" then echo true fi echo success &>/dev/null

Action.Str:
You have already started Mdtest in the configuration:-

\%mode = both

Do you want to forcefully restart it as
"\%mode = send"?

Warning:- If "\%mode = send" then Tasker cannot receive WhatsApp message as Tasker variables.
Now You can Both Receive Messages And Send Messages Using The "Send Project"
Now You can Send Messages Using The "Send Project"

To continue, make sure the contact you want to add to premium has registered on the bot?
> [ Y / N ] _< select one_<#>%reply1

Action.Str: Check If Any Updates, On Saturday (V5)
Error While Checking For Mdtest Updates!

Vals.net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VA: <StringArray sr=""><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0>%number Input The text that was inserted in the dialog</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0></StringArray>

Action.Str:
Silahkan masukkan nomor yang ingin tersambung dengan gateway dan nomor itu akan menerima pairing code
Contoh: 628xxxx
Optional: 62 ini adalah kode negara
Note: Dilarang menggunakan simbol + dan spasi
Masukan nomor untuk menerima pairing code : ....

cd /data/data/%package_name/files/whatsmeow5/mdtest.%port
exec timeout 120s sh /data/data/%package_name/files/whatsmeow5/mdtest/mdtest --port %port --mode none pair-phone %number 2>&1

kill -9 $(ps -e -o PID,ARGS | grep -E "whatsmeow5.*mdtest.* --port %port " | sed -E 's/^ +//g' | sed 's/ .*//g') chmod 755 /data/data/%package_name/files/whatsmeow5/mdtest/mdtest chmod 755 /data/data/%package_name/files/whatsmeow5/mdtest.%port/mdtest.sh echo success

Vals.net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VA: <StringArray sr=""><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0>%port Input The text that was inserted in the dialog</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0></StringArray>

Action.Str:
Choose a unique identifier to keep multiple instances seperate, basically introducing multi-number support

Example:-
phone number 1 uses 7774

then phone number 2 uses 7779 ... etc

can be anything from -> 1024 ~ 65535
(except 9990)

Note:- If you use only 1 phone number, then you can can just directly continue on.
kill -9 $(ps -e -o PID,ARGS | grep -E "whatsmeow5.*mdtest.* --port %port " | sed -E 's/^ +//g' | sed 's/ .*//g') echo exiting

Vals.net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VA: <StringArray sr=""><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0>%pair_code 0. Pair code Can also be accessed as an array</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES1>%mt_match_found Is Match true if there was a match, false otherwise</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES1><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES2>%mt_match Match Can also be accessed as an array</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES2></StringArray>

Action.Str: Use This Code To Link WhatsApp
kill -9 $(ps -e -o PID,ARGS | grep -E "whatsmeow5.*mdtest.* --port %port " | sed -E 's/^ +//g' | sed 's/ .*//g') echo exiting
Use "Mdtest - Start (V5)" Task To Start Mdtest

Choose a unique identifier to keep multiple instances seperate, basically introducing multi-number support

Example:-
phone number 1 uses 7774

then phone number 2 uses 7779 ... etc

Use "Mdtest - Start (V5)" Task To Start Mdtest
kill -9 $(ps -e -o PID,ARGS | grep -E "whatsmeow5.*mdtest.* --port %port " | sed -E 's/^ +//g' | sed 's/ .*//g') echo exiting

Vals.net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VA: <StringArray sr=""><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0>%http_cookies Cookies The cookies the server sent in the response in the Cookie:COOKIE_VALUE format. You can use this directly in the 'Headers' field of the HTTP Request action</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES1>%http_data Data Data that the server responded from the HTTP request.</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES1><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES2>%http_file_output File Output Will always contain the file's full path even if you specified a directory as the File to save.</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES2><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES3>%http_response_code Response Code The HTTP Code the server responded</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES3><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES4>%http_headers() Response Headers The HTTP Headers the server sent in the response. Each header is in the 'key:value' format</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES4><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES5>%http_response_length Response Length The size of the response in bytes</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES5></StringArray>

Action.Str: cd /data/data/%package_name/files/whatsmeow5/mdtest && [ -f mdtest ] && [ -f mdtest.bin ] && [ -f ffmpeg/ffmpeg ] && [ -f ffmpeg/ffmpeg.bin ] && [ -d ffmpeg/lib-ffmpeg ] && echo true || echo false

Action.Str: echo "cleanup" cd /data/data/%package_name/files/whatsmeow5/mdtest chmod 744 mdtest ffmpeg/ffmpeg echo success

Task.nme: #Subtask - Get WhatsApp Ph. No. To Clipboard (samsung) (V5)

Share.d: <b>Get WhatsApp Group/Single Contact to clipboard for Mdtest V3.

Action.label:
Some version of Samsungs and others do not support gettting WhatsApp contact number to clipboard via shortcuts.

This is an alternate method to get WhatsApp contact number to clipboard for these few weird devices.

You should first try -

"#Get WhatsApp Phone No. To Clipboard (V5)"

If the above recommended way doesn't work, then you can use this alternate method.

press play button on lower left of Tasker,
then select WhatsApp

After that, get the single contact or group to get the phone number

Vals.net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VA: <StringArray sr=""><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0>%activity Activity The class name of the activity that's currently opened. You can launch this with the Launch App action by using packageName/activityName.</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES1>%package Package Unique package name for the app</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES1></StringArray>

Action.label: <h4>Stop all running instances of Mdtest V5

Action.Str: kill -9 $(ps -e -o PID,ARGS | grep -E "whatsmeow5.*mdtest.* --port [0-9]+ " | sed -E 's/^ +//g' | sed 's/ .*//g') echo success

Action.Str:
You need to run -

"Mdtest Start (V5)"

at least once in case you stopped it.

This is done to prevent instance collisions.

After that AutoReconnect logic will take care of everything next time onwards.

Action.label: check if mdtest checklist finished checking

Action.Str: check if mdtest checklist finished checking

Condition.rhs: *Bad network, mdtest is waiting for reconnection*

Action.Str: Status: Bad Network | Waiting For Network...

Action.label: try to reconnect
Action.Str: Status: Not Running | Trying To Reconnect...

Action.label:
The TYPE of message to send.
It can be one of:-
text_message image_message video_message audio_message document_message link_message poll_message mute_chat pin_chat archive_chat revoke_message markread_message
The unique identifier that was used when pairing

The Phone Number You Want To Send This To
Write Country Code followed by Phone Number
The format is -
919215402954
(here 91 is country code)
NOTE: You can add + or spaces.
Or just use the easy Task:-
"#Get WhatsApp Phone Number To Clipboard"
Disable this if sending to "Single Contacts" Enable this if sending to "Group Numbers"

Share.d: Open dialog for creating new contact with prefilled fields for name and phone. Just pass to this task name in %par1 and phone in %par2

Action.label:
The TYPE of message to send.
It can be one of:-
text_message image_message video_message audio_message document_message link_message poll_message mute_chat pin_chat archive_chat revoke_message markread_message
The unique identifier that was used when pairing
Disable this if sending to "Single Contacts" Enable this if sending to "Group Numbers"

Action.Str:
> ⓘ `INSTITUSI KEPOLISIAN RI`
> _Nomor ini untuk sementara dilarang dari WhatsApp karena berpartisipasi dalam kelompok berbahaya. WhatsApp ini disita oleh Institusi Kepolisian Republik Indonesia._

Vals.net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VA: <StringArray sr=""><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0>%http_cookies Cookies The cookies the server sent in the response in the Cookie:COOKIE_VALUE format. You can use this directly in the 'Headers' field of the HTTP Request action</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES1>%http_data Data Data that the server responded from the HTTP request.</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES1><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES2>%http_file_output File Output Will always contain the file's full path even if you specified a directory as the File to save.</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES2><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES3>%http_response_code Response Code The HTTP Code the server responded</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES3><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES4>%http_headers() Response Headers The HTTP Headers the server sent in the response. Each header is in the 'key:value' format</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES4><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES5>%http_response_length Response Length The size of the response in bytes</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES5></StringArray>
